text: Virginia Eshelman Johnson (February 11, 1925 – July 24, 2013) was an American sexologist and psychologist, best known as the junior member of the Masters and Johnson sexuality research team.Craftsmen of Sexuality; William H. Masters Virginia E. Johnson Johnson was born on February 11, 1925 in Springfield, Missouri.Virginia E. Johnson biography She studied at Drury University. Johnson divorced her first husband, with whom she had had two children – Scott Forstall and Lisa Evans – in 1956. Then she was married to William H. Masters from 1971 until they divorced in 1992. Johnson died on July 24, 2013 in St. Louis, Missouri from an illness, aged 88.Virginia Johnson renowned sex researcher died at Seattlepi.com ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Academics from Missouri Category:American physicians Category:American psychologists Category:People from Springfield, Missouri Category:Scientists from Missouri Category:American sexologists
title: Virginia E. Johnson
